Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[build] Allow Windows to override `$(JavaSdkDirectory)`" (#3103) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Allow `$(JavaSdkDirectory)` to be specified within
`Configuration.Override.props` to control the JDK location.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[java-runtimes] Set `%JAVA_HOME%`" (#3104) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
For some unknown reason, the JDK environment on @jonpryor's Windows
machine is "wonky," in that the `src\java-runtimes` directory fails
to build because the Android SDK `dx` command fails to execute
because `dx` cannot find Java:

	> cd src\java-runtimes
	> msbuild
	...
	ERROR: No suitable Java found. In order to properly use the Android Developer
	Tools, you need a suitable version of Java JDK installed on your system.
	We recommend that you install the JDK version of JavaSE, available here:
	  http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads

	If you already have Java installed, you can define the JAVA_HOME environment
	variable in Control Panel / System / Avanced System Settings to point to the
	JDK folder.

	You can find the complete Android SDK requirements here:
	  http://developer.android.com/sdk/requirements.html

This happens when:

 1. `%JAVA_HOME%` refers to a non-existent directory.
    (*How* @jonpryor got an invalid directory in there...)  *or*

 2. `%JAVA_HOME%` is empty and `$(JavaSdkDirectory)` refers to a
    *valid* directory.

(Again, why this happens to @jonpryor but not others on the team has
not yet been determined.)

Fix this by explicitly providing `%JAVA_HOME%` within the `<Exec/>`
task which executes `dx`, so that `java` can be found.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[build] Allow Windows to override `$(JavaSdkDirectory)`" (#3103) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Allow `$(JavaSdkDirectory)` to be specified within
`Configuration.Override.props` to control the JDK location.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Android.Views.Accessibility.Action is a flagged enum" (#3102) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Opened issue "Marshal.StructureToPtr freeze with STRUCTs containing float[] arrays" (#3101) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a STRUCT with this particulare shape:
```
[StructLayout(LayoutKind.Sequential, Pack = 1)]
        public struct RECORD
        {
            public byte reset;
            [MarshalAs(UnmanagedType.ByValArray, SizeConst = 2)]
            public float[] refO2;
            public float ratio;
        }
```
2. Try to marshal the STRUCT
```
RECORD rec = new RECORD();
            int size = Marshal.SizeOf<RECORD>();
            byte[] raw = new byte[size];

            IntPtr ptr = Marshal.AllocHGlobal(size);

                Marshal.StructureToPtr<RECORD>(rec, ptr, true);
             
                //In RELEASE mode this point is never reached
``` 


[MarshalStruct2ptrFreeze.zip](https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/files/3191602/MarshalStruct2ptrFreeze.zip)

### Expected Behavior

Marshal.StructureToPtr<RECORD>(rec, ptr, true); sould not freeze

### Actual Behavior

Marshal.StructureToPtr<RECORD>(rec, ptr, true); never exit

### Version Information

1. On macOS and within Visual Studio, select Visual Studio > About Visual Studio, then click the Show Details button, then click the Copy Information button.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Garbage data when marshalling a float array" (#3100) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a STRUCT that contains a float[] field:
```
[StructLayout(LayoutKind.Sequential, Pack = 1)]
public struct RECORD
{
    public byte tag;
    [MarshalAs(UnmanagedType.ByValArray, SizeConst = 4)]
    public float[] refs;
}
```
2. Marshal the structure to a pointer and print the raw data:
```
            RECORD rec = new RECORD();
            int size = Marshal.SizeOf<RECORD>();
            byte[] raw = new byte[size];
            IntPtr ptr = Marshal.AllocHGlobal(size);
            Marshal.StructureToPtr<RECORD>(rec, ptr, true);
            Marshal.Copy(ptr, raw, 0, size);
            //raw should be all zeroed
```
3. The raw data sould be all zero, but it contains garbage data.

This is a demo.
[FloatMarshalFails.zip](https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/files/3191190/FloatMarshalFails.zip)

### Expected Behavior

The byte[] array of the marshaled STRUCT should be all zeros

### Actual Behavior

The bytes in the array where should be the float[] fields contains garbage data

### Version Information

1. On macOS and within Visual Studio, select Visual Studio > About Visual Studio, then click the Show Details button, then click the Copy Information button.

2. Paste below this comment block.
-->

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Update dependencies.md" (#3099) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody: Ninja was missing from the list, so I added it.

Hi,

Please add the following to the ContentView and ContentPage:

AppearingAnimation: Show the ContentPage and the ContentView with animation, eg. FadeIn, SlideLeft, SlideTop, etc..

DisappearingAnimation: close the ContentPage and the ContentView with animation, eg. FadeIn, SlideLeft, SlideTop, etc..


Thanks,
[Jassim](https://www.softnames.com)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Xamarin Forms Map resets back to last set region" (#6222) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
I have one issue with the forms map. 

When control is panned and the device rotated, the map's region is set to the LastMoveToRegion which is not the current region of the map.

I observed this both on iOS and Android. The expectation is that the map center / zoom level is retained.

Any solution?

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Bug] Shadows not appearing on Android" (#6008) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues -->

### Description

All controls with `HasShadow` property aren't showing anymore shadow (Frame and Floating Action Button). Worked with 

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Use control with `HasShadow` property on Android

### Expected Behavior

Have shadow on the bottom of control

### Actual Behavior

No shadow

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: 3.6.0.344457
- Last known good version: 3.6.0.293080
- IDE: Visual Studio For Mac
- Platform Target Frameworks: <!-- All that apply -->
  - iOS:  12
  - Android: 9
- Android Support Library Version: 28

### Screenshots

<!-- If the issue is a visual issue, please include screenshots showing the problem if possible -->

https://imgur.com/QJfE5EN

### Reproduction Link

<!-- Please upload or provide a link to a reproduction case -->

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[Xharness] Add support to pass extra arguments to the test bcl apps." (#6082) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
There are some tests that fail due to the linker, we need to pass extra args to the test bcl app so that we can configure them accordingly, for example, config the linker. 

PS: @spouliot is looking at the exact issue with the linker, we will later add the required args in a following PR.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[XHarness] Do use the test dlls from the mono downloads." (#6055) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
This updates the project generation. We cannot yet fully remove the submodule because:

1. We are missing the xunit dlls which should be added in the SDK.
2. We have not yet remove all the old style tests. Would make the PR huge, better to deal with it in a diff PR.
3. The xunit CoreLib tests have issues loading all the tests, needs some extra work and again, the PR is already large.

Fixes: https://github.com/xamarin/maccore/issues/1199
Fixes: https://github.com/xamarin/maccore/issues/1204
Fixes: https://github.com/xamarin/maccore/issues/1209
Fixes: https://github.com/xamarin/maccore/issues/1510
